temper.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a tendency to become angry suddenly or easily
temper.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: That temper of hers will get her into trouble one of these days.
According to Nathan, Robin has quite a temper.
Theo needs to learn to control his temper.
Be careful, he’s got a pretty violent temper.
Mason’s temper flared when he spotted his girlfriend kissing another man.
temper.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time
temper.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper.
Watch out – she’s been in a foul temper all day.
Her boss would fly into a temper if a project wasn’t done on time.
It’s no use talking to him when he’s in a temper.
temper.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the general attitude that people have in a particular place at one time
temper.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: the temper of life in Renaissance Italy
temper.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: a quick/short temper
He’s got a quick temper, which gets him into trouble.
a bad/terrible/nasty temper
He ran back home in a terrible temper.
a fiery/violent/explosive temper
Over the years, my sister has learned to control her fiery temper.
have a temper
Grandad had quite a temper, so we usually tried to keep out of his way.
be in a temper
She banged doors and screamed at her mother when she was in a temper.
control/keep your temper
She tried to speak calmly and control her temper.
lose your temper
It was hot and I was beginning to lose my temper.
fly into a temper
He flew into a temper at the slightest thing.
somebody’s temper flares
On bad days, Elaine’s temper would flare into a violent rage.
a fit/flash/burst of temper
A businessman assaulted his wife and son in a fit of temper, a court heard yesterday.
tempers get/become frayed
People were pushing each other, and tempers were becoming frayed.
a temper tantrum
My nephew has temper tantrums if he can’t get his own way.
temper.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make something less severe or extreme
temper.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The heat in this coastal town is tempered by cool sea breezes.
temper.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to make metal as hard as is needed by heating it and then putting it in cold water
